reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Improving tuberculosis control and strengthen health systems in Niger

description.narrative: Niger - Tuberculosis - Save the Children Federation, Inc. - STC HQ. This program has the following goals: Reduce tuberculosis mortality by 30 percent by 2018, in comparison with 2013 levels. The objectives of this program are: Successfully treat at least 85 percent of tuberculosis cases, all forms.. Improve the quality of the program's management and coordination.. Strengthen the capacity of health care staff and facilities to manage tuberculosis, malaria and AIDS.. Detect a total of 50,520 cases of tuberculosis, all forms. Test at least 90 percent of tuberculosis cases for HIV, start 90 percent of patients coinfected with TB/HIV on co-trimoxazole and start 70 percent on antiretrovirals. Increase the proportion of the population with knowledge, attitudes and practices that are favorable to tuberculosis control by 20 percent.. Raise the MDR-TB testing rate among re-treatment cases to at least 70 percent

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for NER-T-SCF

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Number of children <5 in contact with TB patients who began isonizide preventive therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines

PSM-other 1: Number and percentage of IHCs reporting no stock-outs lasting more than 7 days of one of the essential tracer drugs (ACT, quinine salts, cotrimoxazole, paracetamol, ORS, oxytocin, injectable ampicillin, injectable diazepam, misoprostol)
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
HSS SD-other 1 : Number and percentage of blood bags tested for markers (HIV, syphilis, hepatitis B and C)
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)
Percentage of reporting units reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drugs on the last day of the quarter
Impact indicator for NER-T-SCF
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
Under 5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
TB I-Other: Notification rates of bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary TB cases (new and recurrences) per 100,000 inhabitants
Outcome indicator for NER-T-SCF
TB O-Other 1: Rates of use of curative treatment
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
